A Visitor From Another World.quote: My weirdo partner won't shut up about some non-animal animal he found in the Wildspire Waste. Do you wanna tag along? Whatever it is, it's bound to be something interesting!

A Visitor from Another World Information:
Conditions: HR 16 or Higher
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.

Update your game to Patch 5.00 or above, and visit Astera. To the right of the Resource Center, you will find a "Serious Handler" NPC with a blue exclamation mark. Talk to her and then this quest will become available from your quest board.
Once in the Wildspire Waste, follow the Cactular Cutting creatures. You can capture them for 85 points each. The Cactuar located at the zone 8 sand-pit can also be captured for 300 points.

Eventually, you will have a cutscene with a Kulu-Ya-Ku, which you must chase and defeat. An Anjanath and Barroth will interrupt you so bring Dung Pods. Finishing this quest grants a guaranteed Golden Large Crown for Kulu-Ya-Ku.
After the quest talk to the Serious Handler again to proceed to the next quest in Elder's Recess, The Legendary Beast.

Slay the Behemoth
A Behemoth has appeared in the Elder's Recess. Conventional methods won't work, call upon other trustworthy hunter-adventurers to help quell the beast!

A Visitor from Eorzea Information:
Requirements: HR 16+
Failure Conditions: 35 minutes, Faint 3 times.
Health Pool(solo or multiplayer do not matter Behemoth is a raid boss and his health pools never change) 
  
Health = 35,000
Horns = 500(x2 to break off first horn, x3 to break second horn)
Head = 2500
Body = 4500
Left Arm = 2250(x3 to break Left arm for shearclaw)
Right Arm = 2250(x3 to break right arm for shearclaw)
Left Leg = 1650
Right Leg = 1650
Tail Flinch = 1200
Tail Cut = 2000(cut damage only)
A Visitor from Eorzea Notes: Drachen armor is the most common reason players attempt this quest. You do not need to slay behemoth to obtain Drachen. Plunder blade can be used to obtain Behemoth mane and Behemoth bones. His horns can be obtained by breaking them, this can be easily done by using sleep ammo two and putting him to sleep then placing bombs by his horns, if you can, have him sleep under the falling boulders and "wake up" using the falling boulder onto his horn this will break his horns instantly. Behemoth tail is easily obtained by applying cut damage to his tail. This is easily done in a group, once tail is removed, carve when safe, then return from quest(DO NOT ABANDON, you will not get carve if you do). Behemoth shearclaw is the hardest of the materials to obtain for Drachen which require breaking one of his arms 3 times, this means dealing 6750 damage. This can be done with the falling boulder/wake up method but takes some practice.

Across the Lost Path.quote: We've discovered a new path in the Guiding Lands that even monsters tread carefully around. This may not be an issue from a long-term perspective, but it warrants investigation.

Across the Lost Path Information:
Conditions: MR 24 or higher. Must have completed Iceborne's Master Rank Main Quest.
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Special Reward:Unlocks Guiding Lands Tundra Region and Stygian Zinogre

This quest is obtained by talking to The Seeker in Seliana after installing patch 12.01. The quest is denoted by a purple exclamation icon over the NPC. You must complete the main Iceborne questline to be able to do this assignment.

Make sure to bring Hot Drink as you'll be in combat in an extreme cold hazard zone. You'll travel to the Guiding Lands and follow the Handler into a frozen area. You'll have to hunt a Stygian Zinogre, which means you can also capture it to save some time and improve your rewards.
When you complete the quest, a cutscene will hint at an upcoming new monster.

Once back at Seliana, return to The Seeker to trigger another cutscene for a short dialogue that unlocks the next special assignment: Point of No Return. This assignment is a new type called "Recon Assignment, and only available from the GATHERING HUB, and can be completed multiple times.

Banquet in the Earthen Hall Walkthrough: Please see The Fury of El Dorado for an Arch-Tempered version of this quest.
You will be able to do this quest after you have uncovered enough Kulve Taroth tracks by going out in an Expedition.

Siege is a newly added game mode that demands the assistance from all hunters in the same Gathering Hub. The 16 hunters will then be divided off into groups of 4 and the mission will start. Everyone will be working together to investigate and hunt down the same Kulve Taroth.

All hunting parties can collect tracks and breaks off parts from attacking Kulve Taroth which will contribute progress to the same Siege. This new quest type is designed and balanced for multiplayer, so get together and work together with other hunters if you want to earn the rewards.

The goal of this Siege is to repel Kulve Taroth, however its shimmering golden appearance are a collection of shiny weapon relics it has gathered during its journey. The nature and quality of these weapons are entirely up to fate like the feystone and streamstone. The type of weapon and stats on them are randomly assigned.

Completing the special "Fury" state of Arch-Tempered Kulve Taroth rewards players with special Rainbow-tier items called "Incadescent Weapons" as appraisal items. See Kulve Taroth Weapons for details.
Skills and Items for Quest Success

Scholar

Speed up progress levels and Special Investigations. (Level 1)
 
Scenthound

 50% faster Gauge fill rate. (Level 1)

Part Breaker

Deals 10%, 20%, and 30% more damage for rank 1, 2, and 3 respectively

Pro Transporter

Increases movement speed while transporting and reduces downtime on landings.  (Level 1) 
    
Lets you move cannonballs faster.

Cool Drinks
Heat Guard (same effect as a cool drink but permanent) 
  
Provided by the armors: Barnos chest A and B, and Lavasioth A

Heavy Artillery

Increases the firepower of ballistae and cannons 
    
Deals 10% and 20% more damage for rank 1 and 2 respectively
Banquet in the Earthen Hall Notes:
Pursuit Level (PL) 6 is the highest attainable level, making each run less difficult as the level increases.
Reward Level (RL) 17 is the highest attainable level, granting the best rewards at the end of a siege.

Contract: Trouble in the Ancient Forest.quote: Attention field team! An anomaly has been discovered in the Ancient Forest. Help the witcher resolve this issue. In this quest, you will get to play as Geralt of Rivia. - Client: The Commander

Contract: Trouble in the Ancient Forest:
Conditions: Complete Investigate the Anomaly at the Research Base
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Objectives: Meet up with the Chief Botanist, Meet up with the Endemic Life Researcher.
Side Quests: Pukei-Pukei in Peril, The Chief Issue
Special Reward: Hunter Runestone, Attack Boost Decoration (finish all sidequest for deco)

After installing Patch 6.0, talk to the Felynes in the Tradeyard and begin Investigate the Anomaly at the Research Base. Follow the quest until Geralt of Rivia arrives, and accept the opportunity to help Geralt solve the Ancient Forest contract.

You will play as Geralt, and can approach the Smithy Apprentice, which allows you to customize your equipment. Geralt can use the Igni Fire Sign to deal damage, and can select from the following Rare 6 weapons, or his special Rare 8 Sword and Shield:

Contract: Woodland Spirit.quote: A portal appeared in the Ancient Forest, and a strange creature came through it. The beast is called a woodland spirit and it's extremely dangerous. Quest level close to Death March! difficulty in The Witcher 3. Client - Commander.

Contract: Woodland Spirit Information:
Conditions: HR50 or higher
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Rewards: Higher quality Leshen materials that will be required to upgrade the Witcher’s Silver Sword into the Witcher's Silver Sword +, Zireael, Ciri Alpha Armor Set, Ciri’s Full Layered Armor, and Geralt’s Full Layered Armor.

This quest’s difficulty will be on par with Extreme Behemoth. While it is possible to solo, Ancient Leshen’s large health pool and summoning mechanics will make it extremely difficult. Gather some friends or find a lobby that is hosting this quest to easily find other players as SOS were little to none during the time I attempted.

Upon arrival quickly open your map and fly to Camp 11 in the Northeast as the Ancient Leshen starts in Quadrant 12. Pick up the Redpit slinger thats on the slope near camp. Jump across the gap, swing from the vine, and head down the root to be outside of the Leshen’s first area. Hopefully, one member of the team have wide range to share their buffs with the whole team. These buffs include:

Mega Demondrug
Mega Armorskin
Demon Powder
Hardshell Powder
Attack Seeds
Defense Seeds

Enter Quadrant 12 by crawling under the tree vine and have 1 member turn left, look up and shoot down the boulder onto of the Leshen. Doing this deals 3375 damage to the Leshen and 480 to the surrounding Jagras. Another member should run up to the Leshen and drop their Health Booster. Other team members should dawn their Temporal Mantle and go to town. Temporal Mantle will negate heavy damage but the chip damage taken from the Leshen’s crow aura will bypass it thus needing the Health Booster on the ground to counter it. I usually refrain from popping my Temporal until a minute goes by so not all Temporal Mantles will be on cool down at the same time.

The Leshen fights similarly as the one everyone had to fight in Contract: Trouble in the Ancient Forest. His primary attacking are summoning roots to attack the player. The offensive version will travel in a linear V-shaped path while the defensive version will summon a wall of roots around the Leshen which will spread outward 3 times.If players get too close he will swing his arms punching the player away. He also have a root attack that will come up from the ground at the feet of a random player. This attack has a long range on where it can spawn and it has a moderate range from which it extends to. He can send out his murder of crows to attack the player in succession.

The deadly attack to watch out for is a CC type move from the Leshen which he will imprison a player with roots. The crows will deal damage over time as well as the Leshen may attack the player or summon his pack of Jagras until the Leshen will shoot a bursting root at the player. This attack is lethal as a 200 HP character with good defense will barely survive it let alone if they were already weak or was attack by other beings once caught. Luckily your teammates can save you if you are caught. Use the hunter Runestone or Igni to set the roots aflame. Alternatively, players may also flash the Leshen which will break the hold.

The Leshen likes to teleport around the area, so using the slinger and shooting him will stagger him at times allowing your teammates to continue their onslaught. There are scatternuts, redpits, puddle pods, and the Leshen will drop dragon and piercing pods that all can be used.

When the Ancient Leshen summons his Jagras pack make sure to eliminate them as quick as possible. These Jagras are tanky and are highly annoying due to the vast number of them while the Leshen will enclose players in a root prison while distracted. Players that have long weapons like a longsword should focus them down to allow the other teammates to focus on the Ancient Leshen. If overrun use flash pods to temporarily stun the Leshen and all the Jagras.

At times the Ancient Leshen will cause a large rumble and explode scattering tons of crows throughout the map. This attack hits very hard so it’s not wise to try to tank it. This attack is similar to Teostra’s fire AOE which they charge up then explodes. A flash pod will be able to counter this attack or simply use your superman dive to safely avoid it. This attack may occur up to 4 times during this quest.
The Leshen has 2 different paths he may take during this quest.

Path 1 is Quadrant 12, 8, 7, finally 6.
Path 2 is Quadrant 12, 5, 4, finally 2.

Hitting the Leshen with the boulder in Quadrant 12 is a must!
Bring Temporal Mantles and Health Boosters
Health Augment on your weapon can counter the chip damage from the Leshen’s crow aura.
Having 1 player healing the team will improve success rate.
If players have weapons that helps them mount, take advantage of it.
Ancient Leshen is 3 star weak to fire, 2 star weak to dragon and thunder
Poison is the ailment he is weakest to.
Paralyze can allow players extra time to attack.
 Bring Flash Pods

This quest is straightforward and upon acceptance, the hunter is placed at the entrance to the Arena. The goal of the quest is to hunt the Paolumu and Rathalos present within the arena before the time expires. Don't forget to pick up the 3 Flash Pods provided in the quest's supply box. They will be useful as both targets are able to take to the sky.  Finally, the Paolumu and Rathalos are initially located quite far apart from each other, making it possible to fight each of them seperately if the hunter keeps his distance, making the fight rather trivial.

Into the Palace of Flame.quote: Client: Provisions ManagerA request to track down a Lunastra has come in! I wonder what it's like to be treated like an empress. Take this quest, mon etoile, and show me...

Into the Palace of Flame Information:
Conditions: MR 50 or higher
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Hunt a Lunastra. This is an Elder Dragon so traps won't work. Bring the Temporal Mantle and Fireproof Mantle to help, and make good use of nulberries to remove Fireblight as needed.

Lunastra's nova can be avoided by doing a dodge jump at the right time or using a Farcaster, and countered by spamming heals. Level 5 Windproof/3 Piece Kushala set bonus will also negate the windpressure from some of Lunastra's attacks. This in turn makes attacks, like her nova, much easier to survive.

Investigate The Anomaly at the Research.quote: Something has happened at the Research Base. Head there at your earliest convenience. This is a special assignment unrelated to the Research Commission's main mission of solving the Elder Crossing. Speak to the Third Fleet member with a blue! above her head to advance the special assignment.

Investigate The Anomaly at the Research:
Conditions: MHW Patch 6.0
Failure Conditions: N/A
Unlocks Quest: Contract: Trouble in the Ancient Forest

Monster Hunter World Update 6.0 must be installed for this quest to show up. Load into Astera and talk to the group of Felynes that are just to the right of the entrance in the tradeyard. They will tell you that they encountered a never before seen tailrider during their latest safari, and that the Third Fleet's Lynian Expert wishes to talk to you.

Accept and travel to the Research Base to begin the questline. When you talk to the Lynian Expert, you are made aware of a strange creature (A Nekker) that has appeared and seems out of this world. The Commander is summoned to oversee the situation.

Turns out, the creature was first spotted in the Ancient Forest, and as the team discusses it Geralt of Rivia appears from a sudden portal. Geralt points the creature out as a Nekker, which leads to Geralt offering his services to hunt where this new monster might have come from. An unusually large number of Revoltures have been spotted in the Ancient Forest, and Geralt sets forth with the assistance of the Research Commission.
A new screen appears: Do you want to help Geral of Rivia?

You get to play as Geralt of Rivia
Equipment for this quest is predetermined
You can only keep quest reward items
Meal effects are lost upon departing
This will not count towards the guild card's weapon usage statistics
Selecting yes will transform you into The Witcher and begin Contract: Trouble in the Ancient Forest.

It's a Crying Shamos.quote:
Slay 11 Shamos.
I almost feel bad for 'em. Those scrawny little monsters don't even stand a chance. Go flex on 'em while I get the goods!

It's a Crying Shamos Information:
Conditions: HR 6 or higher, given by Meowscular Chef
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Notable Reward: King Turkey ingredient
Start from Southern Camp (1), head east and follow the lower path to encounter all the targets.

It's the Afterlife for Me.quote: Client: Seliana ArmoryIve' been going bonkers thinkin' about how I can upgrade your specialized tools. Your gear might be immune to abnormal status effects but it ain't immune to my upgrades! (Upgrades Immunity Mantle upon first completion)

It's the Afterlife for Me Information:
Conditions: MR 19 or higher
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Requires having Level 4 Blackveil Vaal Hazak research to unlock the quest.

Hunt a Blackveil Vaal Hazak. This is an Elder Dragon so traps won't work. The skill Effluvial Resistance is useful to prevent Effluvial Buildup; optionally you can bring the Cleanser Booster or plenty of Nulberries. Being under the influence of Effluvia will also make the Elder Dragon absorb your health, so clear the status as soon as possible!

Kings Know No Fear.quote: Just looking at Rathalos reminds me of how irrelevant I am compared to the King of the Skies. And I hate it! Help me be famous too!

Kings Know No Fear Information:
Conditions: slay an Azure Rathalos and a Rathalos
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Special Rewards: Faux Ticket II

Kulve Taroth Siege Information:
Objective: Break Kulve Taroth Horns
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Notable Reward: Kulve Taroth Weapons, Bushi Ticket

Siege is a newly added game mode that demands the assistance from all hunters in the same Gathering Hub. The 16 hunters will then be divvied off into groups of 4 and the mission will start. Everyone will be working together to investigate and hunt down the same Kulve Taroth.

All hunting parties can collect tracks and breaks off parts from attacking Kulve Taroth which will contribute progress to the same Siege. This new quest type is designed and balanced for multiplayer, so get together and work together with other hunters if you want to earn the rewards.

The goal of this Siege is to repel Kulve Taroth, however its shimmering golden appearance are a collection of shiny weapon relics it has gathered during its journey. The nature and quality of these weapons are entirely up to fate like the feystone and streamstone. The type of weapon and stats on them are randomly assigned.

Landing the Landside Wyvern.quote:
Capture a Barroth.
Barroth dwell in the marshes of the Wildspire Waste, but details of their activities, diet, and nesting habits remain unknown. Catch one to help shed light on the issue.

Landing the Landside Wyvern Information:
Conditions: HR 3 or higher, given by Smart Biologist
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times, Barroth is slain
This quest becomes available once the following quests have been completed:

Pretty similar to Mired in the Spire but you need to capture the target.Start from Central Camp (6), look for it in the sector and fight until it limps and flees towards sector 9.Since you can't put Shock Trap in the water and the Barroth can destroy mud, put the trap near the Round Cactus and lure it here. It can help to use a few Tranq Bomb while the monster is asleep.If it's the first time you capture a Barroth, you'll unlock the Special Arena: Barroth optional quest.
This quest is part of the quest line that ultimately unlocks the Thunderproof Mantle.

\u00a0Quest Walkthrough:
It is Highly recommended to run Heat guard in your build while fighting this Xeno to negate the damage from "hot spots". Kulve Taroth's Wrath Gamma is a very good for this.
Tremor Resistance is very useful against Arch Tempered Xeno.
Moxie and Felyene Insurance is recommended.

It'll flee toward sector 7 to renew the mud on its body.When it start getting too weak, it'll flee toward sector 9 and cover himself in the mud. Don't underestimate the water effect on your movements when fighting in this area.It's also impossible to put Shock Trap in deep water.

Mosswinin' and Dinin'.quote: The Admiral and Meowscular Chef trapped some Mosswine and put them into the Arena. I didn't have the courage to tell them, but those Mosswine look purr-ty odd to me. Take a look!

Conditions: Rank 11 or Higher

This special Event Quests is a special New Year quest available only on January 1st. Players can launch it from the event quests menu and travel to the arena to face 5 Giant Mosswine monsters and obtain the associated rewards.
Be warned: The Mosswine are actually quite deadly and can faint you in one hit. You can use rocks to stun them with your Slinger, as well as traps and flash bugs.
Mosswinin' and Dinin' Notes: There are no other Monsters in this quest.

Piercing Black.quote: Client: Seliana ArmoryI've been going bonkers thinkin' about how I can upgrade your specialized tools. You get me the materials I need and no monster will be knocking you around! (Upgrades the Rocksteady Mantle upon first completion.)

Conditions: MR 17 or higher

\u00a0How to get the Piercing Black Ques: Unlocked after upgrading the Ghillie Mantle, Vitality Mantle, Iceproof Mantle and Thunderproof Mantle.

Pink Power Grab.quote: Client: Chief EcologistThe exodus of Legiana has created a power vaccum in the Coral Highlands. A rather fearsome Pink Rathian seems inclined to fill that void. However, her reign is having a detrimental effect on the food chain. I ask you go out and usurp the throne, Hunter!

Pink Power Grab Information:
Conditions: MR 6 or higher
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.

Point of No Return.quote: We need you to do some recon on that red monster. Remember, don't get in over your head. Get in, find out what you need, then get out..

Point of No Return Information:
Conditions: MR 24 or higher. Must have completed Iceborne's Master Rank Main Quest and Across the Lost Path assignment.
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Special Reward: Rigid Dracolite, Stygian Zinogre Claws (Pendant), Stygian Zinogre will appear in Guiding Lands.
This quest is obtained by talking to the Pub Lass at the Gathering Hub and selecting ??? Recon to begin a Recon Assignment. This quest is only available after completing Across the Lost Path.

During this quest, you'll face a ferocious unnamed dragon. You must use your slinger to break some rocks onto its head and follow it further down after you first damage it. Once down, deal damage as best you can until a large attack begins to form. Hide behind one of the protruding rocks to be safe

Once the quest ends, talk to The Seeker in Seliana. A new cutscene will play that will speculate the monster is an adult version of Xeno'jiiva. This unlocks a limited time siege to Prepare for the Return of Xeno'jiiva.

When the siege is available the Commander will appear in Seliana with a purple ! mark over his head. Speak to him to join the siege. The siege of Xeno'jiiva's mature form is only available for a limited time. It cannot be undertaken outside of the available time, even if the commander is present. The Recon can be undertaken as many times as you like, and serves as practice run for the real event. Rewards received from the recon change after the first completion.

From Central Camp (6) climb the vine directly on the left outside and go north to find 3 Round Cactus, one more is just north of the rocky bridge and another one east of the cacti populated platform. Safi'jiiva Siege Information:
Objective: Slay Safi'jiiva
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Notable Reward: ??

The Safi'jiiva Siege is a special quest where you team up with all hunters in your Gathering Hub to slay Safi'jiiva. Go to the quest counter in the Gathering Hub to join the Safi'jiiva Siege. This is a fight designed for multiplayer, so it's highly recommended to fight this monster with a full party. The further you drive Safi'jiiva underground and advance the investigation, the better the rewards you'll receive upon completion.
The Safi'jiiva siege is only available for a limited time in the Gathering Hub. Players can join a siege in progress but SOS flares cannot be used.
Check Safi'jiiva info to see investigation progress.

Level Energy: This shows the remaining energy in each level of the Secluded Valley. As participants in the siege complete objectives and the energy stores are depleted, it becomes easier to drive Safi'jiiva deeper underground.
Reward Level: The higher the reward level, the better the rewards. Complete research entries and you'll accumulate points that will raise your reward level.
You can only receive a certain amount of points from other parties. If your party completes an already completed objective, the reward level will be overwritten.
The siege is completed once someone in your Gathering Hub has successfully slain Safi'jiiva.
Head to the quest counter in the gathering hub to pick up special rewards based on your reward level.

Each gathering hub investigates one specific Safi'jiiva. If you move to another gathering hub, your reward level will reset and you can obtain your rewards. You can investigate other Safi'jiiva during the available time period. Also, keep in mind that your special rewards will be available even after the Safi'jiiva siege is no longer available.

The goal of the investigation is to work together with all hunters in your gathering hub to drive Safi'jiiva to the lowest level of the Secluded Valley and slay it. As Safi'jiiva health decreases, it will suck up the energy from the current level. Once the energy has been completely depleted, it will seek out more energy deeper underground. Focus on breaking parts and using environmental attacks on top of regular attacks to keep it moving. Work with other hunters to deplete each level's energy and drive Safi'jiiva to the lowest level. Once a party in your Gathering Hub slays Safi'jiiva, the siege is complete!
Safi'jiiva requires special strategies in order to defeat

Environmental AttacksThe perimeter of the 1st Level features several spots that can be used to greatly deplete Safi'jiiva's energy. Stagger Safi'jiiva and drive it out to the edges, where you can use the environment to your advantage.
Safi'jiiva's MovementSafi'jiiva will doggedly focus its attacks on the hunter that deals the most damage to it. When it's focused on a hunter, it is more likely to use highly energy-consuming attacks, so take advantage of this chance to reduce its energy.
Drawing Safi'jiiva's AttacksThe hunter that Safi'jiiva is focusing on can draw its attacks by continuously attacking it. If the hunter fails at keeping its attention, Safi'jiiva will enter a much more dangerous, aggressive state. Hunters who are not being focused on can perform flinch shots on its head to draw its focus, so hunters with superior defensive skills can help turn the tide of battle.
Avoiding Safi'jiiva Ultimate AttackSafi'jiiva can unleash a massive area-clearing attack that can cause you to faint in one shot, and cannot be dodged normally. The attack has a long build-up, so once you see it coming, take shelter behind obstacles in the environment. Farcaster usage is disabled during the build-up and final execution of this attack. If you guide its beam attacks strategically, it will drop boulders that are necessary to mitigate this attack. If your party fails to get Safi'jiiva to shoot its attacks to drop boulders, your party will be unable to dodge this attack - resulting in a full party wipe and objective failure.

Quest Information:
Conditions: HR 13 or higher.
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Other Monsters: None
Client: Arena Lass

This quest is relatively straightforward. Upon acceptance, the hunter is put at the Hunter's camp in the Special Arena and can prepare for the upcoming fight by managing his load-out at the tent and by eating at the Canteen. As with any special arena quests, once you enter the arena through the cable line, you can make use of 2 cannons, 2 balistas, a droppable boulder and last but not least, the dragonator. The goal of the quest is to hunt the Rathalos within the arena before the time expires.

Sterling Pride.quote: You hear the rumors of the ol' Shattered Horn? Sounds like it's shown up in the Hoarfrost Reach, but why it's there and why its horn is broken is as clear as mud! Sounds like a mystery worth investigating, eh? - The Admiral

Sterling Pride Information:
Conditions: MR 24 or higher. Must have completed Iceborne's Master Rank Assignments.
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.

This quest is obtained by talking to The Admiral in Seliana after installing patch 11.03. The quest is denoted by a purple exclamation icon over the NPC. The Kirin you must slay for this quest is not as powerful as the ones in the Guiding Lands, so regular tactics work.
When you complete the quest, return to the admiral for a cutscene that unlocks the next quest: Reveal Thyself, Destroyer.

Stick Your Nose Somewhere Else.quote: Client: CommanderWe've got reports coming in from all locations confirming the existence of some unusually tough monster. Head to their location and begin your investigation ASAP.

Stick Your Nose Somewhere Else Informati:
Conditions: MR 4 or higher
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.

Stirrings from the Grave.quote:
Slay a Vaal Hazak.
Vaal Hazak serves its purpose in the life cycle of the New World, but now that it has stirred from its nest of decay, it threatens to ruin the whole ecosystem. It must be stopped!

Stirrings from the Grave Information:
Conditions: HR 14 or higher
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.

Stuck in a Rut.quote:
Hunt a Radobaan.
We've gotten a disturbing report of an unusually powerful Radobaan appearing in the Rotten Vale. Begin your investigation ASAP, but beware its rolling attacks!

Stuck in a Rut Information:
Conditions: HR 11 or higher, find a Radobaan during an High-Rank quest/expedition.
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
High-Rank monsters have more HP, hit harder but act just like their Low-Rank counterpart.

Stuck in Their Ways.quote:
Capture a Tobi-Kadachi.
Those three crazy old scholars went to study a LIVE Tobi-Kadachi. Please go capture it before they hurt themselves!

Stuck in Their Ways Information:
Conditions: HR 11 or higher, given by Shy Scholar in the  Research Base
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Notable Reward: Wyvern Amber Ale ingredient

The Distant Dark Tide.quote: My mother used to lead a hunting party and told me once of a story where pleasant weather turned to violent storms, forcing the party back and spoiling a fine expedition. Perhaps the cause was Namielle. I hope your hunt divulges some answers... - Client: Blue-eyed Hunter

The Distant Dark Tide Information:
Objective: Slay Arch-Tempered Namielle
Conditions: MR 100 or higher; Max Players: 4
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
First Clear Rewards: Arch-Tempered Namielle Shard Pendant,
Unlisted Special Rewards:  Namielle Ticket (1-3)- used to craft Namielle γ+ Armor Set,  Evasion Charm V, etc.
HP: 36,000 (Solo); 57,880 (2 Players); 86,400 (3-4 Players)
The Arch-Tempered version of the Namielle monster can be extremely deadly. Note its very high damage and OHKO potential via many of its moves.

Eat for Felyne Safeguard (6x Preparation Ingredients) and Felyne Insurance (Daily Skill) at the Canteen before the hunt.
Ranged weapons work best with proper spacing and knowledge of attack patterns. Otherwise, it may lead to getting one-shotted
Note that Namielle takes 0 damage from shot type damage on its wings when shot from the outside. it still takes damage if shot from inside.
It tends to flood the whole field with water, and it can tremor the hunter much more often than regular Namielle
Its electricity can arc much farther than a regular Namielle. Take care to notice the position of puddles of water while in battle.
Bring Vitality mantle and Temporal Mantle. Rocksteady mantle, if used improperly, may lead to an early demise.
Can only be flinch-shotted once into a wall before it gets enraged.
Do NOT try to tackle, roll, or tank the large electric discharge (ultimate move). use the dive evade (superman dive) instead.
Both Water Resistance and Thunder Resistance skills are recommended, preferably more than 20 points to prevent Waterblight and Thunderblight.
Bring healing items for your companions (i.e. Dust of Life, Lifepowder, or preferably having one support (wide-range) on the team)
Namielle has very good hitzones for fire (elemental damage) when wet (and charged) all over, while it has very good hitzones for raw damage when dry.
Use Brightmoss to drain the puddles around the area
If your mantles are down and she is "electric" beware of OHKO from her slam
Patience! Slow and steady wins the quest; don't underestimate the damage it can deal in one move.

The Eternal Gold Rush.quote: The mother goddess has reappeared. This time, our objective is to slay her. Get the quest from your handler or the quest board. Stand tall against her fury and return safely!

The Eternal Gold Rush Information:
Conditions: MR 24 or Higher
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Rewards: Kulve Taroth + materials used to upgrade Appraisal Kulve Taroth Weapons
You can now upgrade appraisal weapons at the Smithy, simply navigate to the Upgrade Equipment menu and select which appraisal weapon you want to upgrade. Master Rank Kulve Taroth materials are required to upgrade appraisal weapons. Use these materials to store upgrade points and raise the weapon's level to make it stronger.
Appraisal weapons, once upgraded, can't be augmented by the high rank augment system (streamstones). However, if the weapon's level is maxed out, it can be augmented via the new Master Rank augment system (i.e. by materials from the Guiding Lands).
Tips for this Fight:
While the quest info says that the time limit is 50 minutes, there is a hidden timer for each stage of the fight (about 7-8 minutes per stage).  If not enough damage is dealt to Kulve within this time period, the monster will escape, ending the quest with greatly reduced rewards.
Ranged weapons are a lot easier to manage
Use Thunder element for Gold plated phase, then Ice element afterward
Use Partbreaker skill
Bring Wide-Range or group healing items
Use your clutch claw to weaken the chest during phase 1
Use your slinger clutch attacks to throw her into walls
Master Rank Kulve Taroth's event quest, The Eternal Gold Rush, is different from the siege quest:
1. It can be found under Event Quests - this quest can be found under event quests and not as a special investigation in the Gathering Hub. You cannot take on this quest outside of the set times.
2. Objective: Slay Kulve Taroth - The objective of the quest is to slay Kulve Taroth before it escapes. During this quest, the red icon that appears in the minimap shows if it's enraged or not.

3. No pursuit Levels or Reward Levels - the quest does not contain pursuit levels or reward levels, so progress does not carry over to the next quest. Any progress made on the Kulve Taroth Siege itself will not be affected by this event quest.
4. SOS available - During the quest, you can fire SOS flares.

5. User Materials to Upgrade Appraisal Weapons: Materials obtained are used to upgrade appraisal weapons. While you cannot obtain weapons directly from master rank Kulve Taroth, you use its materials to upgrade any appraisal weapons you already possess.
The Eternal Gold Rush Notes: Completing this quest will grant the player the Golden Kulve Pendant (by default) and the Golden Kjárr Pendant (only if the player has completed the quest The Fury of El Dorado at least once)

The Fury of El Dorado.quote: The old girl is back and stronger than ever, this time dressed to the nines in a glittering white gold cot! With the First and Fifth working together, we won't let this golden opportunity go to waste!

The Fury of El Dorado Information:
Repel Arch-Tempered Kulve Taroth
Conditions: HR 16 or higher

Unlisted Special Rewards(s): Kulve Taroth Emperor Nugget to forge the Kulve Taroth γ armor. Bushi Ticket
Other Monsters: 
  
Gajalaka
The Fury of El Dorado Mechanics:
Kulve Taroth is a "Raid Boss" meaning there is only one mode, multiplayer. Meaning you can solo, have two people, three people, four people, but her health pools are the same, so the more the merrier.
Session Mechanics on KT - KT has an interesting mechanic that if anyone in the session increases the pursuit level than the pursuit level for the entire session is the same level if they are to start one. This will not increase pursuit levels of previously started runs. This will make KT easier to complete but this will lower your rewards if you did not join a pursuit level 1 prior. The down side is that if another team breaks her horns off this will reset the entire session's pursuit level back to pursuit level 1 and forcing everyone to collect their respective reward levels(1 to 17). So if you are in a run and you receive the message "another team has completely broken Kulve's horns" your team needs to complete this run to maximize the reward level or be forced to collect rewards most likely two high rarity rewards and the rest pretty much useless. 
  
SUMMARY - you need to be in a run that breaks KT's horns and have been in a pursuit level one prior the most recent horn break to maximize your reward's quality and quantity.
 
Reward level - There are 17 reward levels for KT, these are respective to each player in the session and reflect onto the quantity of each player's rewards. These will also rest with the pursuit levels when a group completes KT or you leave the session.

Increasing reward level - you/group your running KT with must break gold parts, break her "naked tail", and completely break her horns. Two reward levels per gold part, One for naked tail, and one for completely breaking her horns.
To increase the rarity of the rewards you must be present of a previous pursuit level one run that did not fail(cart 3 times) to receive the objective "one run completion" NOTE this do not mean you need to complete KT on pursuit level one, this just requires you to have been in a pursuit level one that has not failed and then you break her horns completely off in a higher pursuit level. 
    
Breaking her horns off completely while she is in fury mode. When the game messages you with the handler saying "oh no....." This is do to KT entering fury mode, if the horns are completely removed around this time you will get a message as KT repels stating horns broken during fury.
Random free boxes, you will sometimes randomly get 2 or four high rarity boxes for completing KT. The reason is unknown at the moment which lead to the belief of it being RNG(random Number Generator)
 
 
There are four stages of Kulve taroth, this can be noted by which are she is in, each area requires certain objectives to be met in order for her to move to the next area. If the objective is not met within a small time frame as she enters the new area(timer starts whether you come in with her or not) she will leave, and this is technically not a failed quest but it definitely not a win which translate to wasting time unless it was for a "sniff run"(done mainly in pursuit level one, Idea is to increase the pursuit level, Higher Pursuit level higher the damage multiplier you have on her. 
  
Area one - In this area Kulve Taroth is 99% of the time ignoring you. You need to deal enough damage to her to activate a message stating you have stopped Kulve's retreat. She will then move to area 2 and wait for players to enter but remember as stopping the retreat is becomes active the timer for her to leave will become active as well. In order to deal this amount of damage "bomb strategies" are highly recommended for lower pursuit levels(sub 4 because pursuit levels 4 to 6 are considered free). Part breaker skill is also highly recommended for more damage on her gold.
Area two - In this area Kulve will be attacking you and other players in the area. The objective is to break as many gold parts as possible to stop her retreat forcing her to move to area 3 of the siege. I am unsure of the amount required for her to shed but she will dig when  
    
If you are attacking a broken spot this is pretty much useless since the objective is to break gold to reach the count of 15 total meaning all the damage you were dealing do not contribute to stopping her retreat. with the exception of her chest spikes which is to provoke her "red" state which she has a red aura and her gold becomes weakspots.
 
Area three - The objective of this area is to have her shed her gold mantle, it is a very similar objective to area 2, basically another try at area two. If enough parts were broken in are two she will move to area 3 than transition to area four immediately.
Area Four - In this area the objective is to break off her horns. NOTE THE ONLY DAMAGE THAT MATTERS is damage to her horns. You can do an infinite amount of damage to any part of her body and she will still retreat unless you break the threshold of her horn's health pool. So everyone that is doing damage should be doing the damage to her horns or the damage wouldn't matter. 
    
The only exceptions for this is if you were not in a previous run that already broke her tail(previous pursuit levels and her tail was not broken) and you/your team wishes to increase reward level.
The other exception is if you/your team is dealing damage to one side of her limbs(left limbs share a health pool, right limbs share a health pool) to force a trip so that you and your team can have up time(time where you have windows to do damage) on her horns.
 
 
Pursuit Levels - THE HIGHER THE PURSUIT LEVEL THE EASIER IT WILL BE. The pursuit levels are multipliers on your damage dealt to her Gold/Horns. For example if you hit her and you see 100 it is actually less damage in pursuit level 1, because in pursuit level one the multiplier is less than one(a decimal number) while in pursuit level 6 you will see 100 and the damage actually dealt(not seen) about 400. I will need more testing to obtain actually numbers for the multipliers but for simplicity, the higher the pursuit the higher the multiplier will be on her gold/horn but not displayed in damage. This was observed due to seeing that it took more damage to break a certain part than other pursuit levels. This can be argued that she has less health as the pursuit level increases but this is false by seeing her health pool(3rd party programs) her health pools are the same no matter what pursuit level. In short, it is easier to code a multiplier to your damage than to make am multiplier for each health pool.
The Fury of El Dorado Walkthrough and Ti:
Pursuit Level One(p1) - Doing a P1 is pretty hard without organization/Good Gear/Crowd control due to the pursuit level multiplier mechanics. It is rare to complete a p1 with a random group since there is no coordination. If the team has good gear then the chances of the clear will increase but ideally with a random group you should all just do a sniff run(follow behind KT and pick up her tracks, this will increase pursuit level which will make it easier for the next run)

Sniff Run theory would be to not attack KT at all and the whole team collects tracks. If the whole team collects tracks and do not attack KT the sniff run will end around 8 minutes, then it should be pursuit level 2 if not 3. This is the most efficient way to farm KT with a random group and even in some cases of a team due to bad gear, not enough damage, not using bomb strategies, etc.  P1 with a random group will take 8 to 20 minutes and mostly result in a her retreating and if you/team were not collecting tracks it would be lucky to reach pursuit level 2.
 
 Releasing Kulve Taroth(When Kulve Taroth loses her gold mantle this is known as kulve being released and a message will notify the others in the session this has happened). To do this ideally you will want to break 15 gold parts, this will be her horn gold plating(the carve-able piece that falls off), right and left chest, elbow of left and right arm, left and right rib area, and left and right by the tip of her tail.

Parts Breaker skill is Highly recommended for this.
Her gold is weak to thunder but this will not matter for raw attack scaling weapons since they can deal more damage by just having high attack.
Red state - KT will have a red aura when enough damage is dealt to her and in this state her gold will become weak spots.
Focus on unbroken gold parts. 
    
Area 1 Focus on rock drops to give team up time so they can do a lot of damage. when she falls aim for horns, while she is standing aim for elbows because in area two and three these parts are most difficult to attack as she moves more often.
Area 2 Focus on tail and chest. 
      
Tail Because its easy to attack and very safe since she wont be focus on you and you can see any movements she make.
Chest because there is a big blind spot for her hit boxes at this location for most of her attacks, be aware when she spews lava, body slams, lunges forward.
 
Area 3 Focus on her horns if you have not chipped it(total of 3 horn health pools, horn gold, Horn Chip, and Severing her horns), Rock Drops(3) and keep her on the erupting lava(2). These should be enough to release her for area 4
 
 
Horn Break Area 4, Hopefully you/your team, has chipped her actual horns before this area or you will be dealing with her horn sever health and the chip health. 
  
"Naked KT is weak to ice damage, her horns are weak to ice and cut damage.
Crowd Control(CC) makes this area easier. The setup is usually one crowd control and the rest of the team is damage. The most common CC chain is Sleep, Mount, KO, Paralyze, KO. This will give enough up time for bombing strategies or just freestyle weapons.
FOCUS THE HORNS, Reminder no damage to her matters unless its the horns because you do not win unless her horn's health pool is depleted, meaning you can break her tail/limbs a billion times and never win or you can break her horns once and win. Most beginners think that dealing damage to her anywhere makes her horns come off, this is FALSE. Her horns have a separate health pool and is the one that needs to be depleted in order to win. everything else is just to prevent you from winning so do not focus them.
The Fury of El Dorado Notes:
Pursuit Level (PL) 6 is the highest attainable level, making each run less difficult as the level increases.
Reward Level (RL) 17 is the highest attainable level, granting the best rewards at the end of a siege.

The Greatest Jagras.quote: So I heard that a hunter had a Great Jagras cornered, but when they went to finish it off, a shadow appeared. What do you think it is? Heh, go out and find out for yourself! (Special ticket rewards)

The Greatest Jagras Information:
Conditions: HR 50 or higher
Failure Conditions: Time expires, Faint 3 times.
Special Rewards: Faux Ticket III, Worn Feystone, Warped Feystone, Mysterious Feystone, Glowing Feystone

This special quest makes hunters face off against a deadly Jagras, capable of one or two-shotting even experienced and well-geared opponents. If attempting solo, it is best to come prepared with the Temporal Mantle and to bring along tools such as Pitfall Trap, Shock Trap, Flash Pods etc - as they will make your battle much easier.
This Jagras will drop Feystones for Decorations when it pukes, so make sure to pick up all dropped shinies ASAP for they do despawn if left for some time.

If you are just farming common decorations, wait in Area 1 until he eats, shinies are easier to see and pick up here than near his nest. Aggro him there and just wait for him to vomit and run and pick up shines. Assassin's Hood helps speed this up. In a solo run he will stop spitting up shinies after 30 so you can return from the quest at that point and rerun it. Takes no more than a few minutes each run.If you are farming for rare decorations you should try to complete the quest ASAP for the end rewards of 1-3 Warped Feystones is what you're after.
Farming Walk Through: There are two effective methods known as puke farming and capture. Puke farming, the easier of the two since you do not need any knowledge of the monster or have good gear. All you need to do is to let Great Jagras eat(wait for him to come to area one and eat a Aptonoth and get enlarged) then puke at you(aggro him by attack), of course dodge the puke for it carts you in two if not one attack. And pick up the shinies(Great Jagras Material). After 30 shinies(30 decorations) has spawn no more will spawn after he pukes. At this time end the quest by slaying, capture or just return from expedition.For the more endgame players who just want high rarity decorations you want to do the capture method where you need to capture Great Jagras ASAP to obtain the rewards at the end(Worn Feystone x2 is 100% with chances of  Warped Feystone). This method ideally needs to be done in under 7 minutes for any more then the efficiency of Puke farming is greater(rare decorations to time).How to Capture MethodYou need to be able to deal about 12k-14k damage in under 7 minutes to reach the capture state(total HP is about 16,000 solo). Stomach trip(Give you about 20 seconds of Jagras on his side aft you deal about 700 damage to his belly when he is enlarged, first belly trip)

The Red Dragon Walkthrough and Tips: The Safi'jiiva Siege is a special quest where you team up with all hunters in your Gathering Hub to slay Safi'jiiva. Go to the quest counter in the Gathering Hub to join the Safi'jiiva Siege. This is a fight designed for multiplayer, so it's highly recommended to fight this monster with a full party. The further you drive Safi'jiiva underground and advance the investigation, the better the rewards you'll receive upon completion.
The Safi'jiiva siege is only available for a limited time in the Gathering Hub. Players can join a siege in progress but SOS flares cannot be used.
Check Safi'jiiva info to see investigation progress.

Level Energy: This shows the remaining energy in each level of the Secluded Valley. As participants in the siege complete objectives and the energy stores are depleted, it becomes easier to drive Saji'jiiva deeper underground.
Reward Level: The higher the reward level, the better the rewards. Complete research entries and you'll accumulate points that will raise your reward level.
You can only receive a certain amount of points from other parties. If your party completes an already completed objective, the reward level will be overwritten.
The siege is completed once someone in your Gathering Hub has successfully slain Safi'jiiva.
Head to the quest counter in the gathering hub to pick up special rewards based on your reward level.

Each gathering hub investigates one specific Saji'jiiva. If you move to another gathering hub, your reward level will reset and you can obtain your rewards. You can investigate other Safi'jiiva during the available time period. Also, keep in mind that your special rewards will be available even after the Safi'jiiva siege is no longer available.

The goal of the investigation is to work together with all hunters in your gathering hub to drive Safi'jiiva to the lowest level of the Secluded Valley and slay it. As Safi'jiiva health decreases, it will suck up the energy from the current level. Once the energy has been completely depleted, it will seek out more energy deeper underground. Focus on breaking parts and using environmental attacks on top of regular attacks to keep it moving. Work with other hunters to deplete each level's energy and drive Safi'jiiva to the lowest level. Once a party in your Gathering Hub slays Safi'jiiva, the siege is complete!
Safi'jiiva requires special strategies in order to defeat

Environmental AttacksThe perimeter of the 1st Level features several spots that can be used to greatly deplete Safi'jiiva's energy. Stagger Safi'jiiva and drive it out to the edges, where you can use the environment to your advantage.
Safi'jiiva's MovementSafi'jiiva will doggedly focus its attacks on the hunter that deals the most damage to it. When it's focused on a hunter, it is more likely to use highly energy-consuming attacks, so take advantage of this chance to reduce its energy.
Drawing Safi'jiiva's AttacksThe hunter that Safi'jiiva is focusing on can draw its attacks by continuously attacking it. If the hunter fails at keeping its attention, Safi'jiiva will enter a much more dangerous, aggressive state. Hunters who are not being focused on can perform flinch shots on its head to draw its focus, so hunters with superior defensive skills can help turn the tide of battle.
Avoiding Safi'jiiva Ultimate AttackSafi'jiiva can unleash a massive area-clearing attack that can cause you to faint in one shot, and cannot be dodged normally. The attack has a long build-up, so once you see it coming, take shelter behind obstacles in the environment. Farcaster usage is disabled during the build-up and final execution of this attack. If you guide its beam attacks strategically, it will drop boulders that are necessary to mitigate this attack. If your party fails to get Safi'jiiva to shoot its attacks to drop boulders, your party will be unable to dodge this attack - resulting in a full party wipe and objective failure.
